Package camzup.core

Class Color

java.lang.Object
camzup.core.Color
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable<Color>
public class Color
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Color>
A mutable, extensible color class. Supports RGBA, HSLA and HSVA color spaces. Converts to and from integers where color channels are in the format 0xAARRGGBB.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    static class  Color.AbstrEasing
    An abstract class to facilitate the creation of color easing functions.
    static class  Color.ChannelOrder
    Order in which to arrange color channels when flattening color to an array.
    static class  Color.HueCCW
    Eases between hues in the clockwise direction.
    static class  Color.HueCW
    Eases the hue in the counter-clockwise direction.
    static class  Color.HueEasing
    An abstract parent class for hue easing functions.
    static class  Color.HueFar
    Eases between hues by the farthest rotational direction.
    static class  Color.HueNear
    Eases between hues by the nearest rotational direction.
    static class  Color.LerpLrgba
    Converts two colors from standard RGB to linear RGB, mixes them with linear interpolation, then converts back to standard RGB.
    static class  Color.LerpSrgba
    Eases between two colors in sRGB, i.e., with no gamma correction.
    static class  Color.MixHsla
    Eases between colors by hue, saturation and lightness.
    static class  Color.MixHsva
    Eases between colors by hue, saturation and value.
    static class  Color.MixLab
    Eases between two colors in CIE L*a*b* color space.
    static class  Color.SmoothStepSrgba
    Eases between two colors in sRGB, i.e., with no gamma correction, using the smooth step formula: t2 ( 3.0 - 2.0 t ) .

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo​(Color c)
      Returns -1 when this color is less than the comparisand; 1 when it is greater than; 0 when the two are 'equal'. The implementation of this method allows collections of colors to be sorted.
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Color>
      Parameters:
      c - the comparisand
      Returns:
      the numeric code

      Tests to see if the alpha channel of the color is greater than zero, i.e. if it has some opacity.
      Parameters:
      c - the color
      Returns:
      the evaluation

    • bitAnd

      public static Color bitAnd​(Color a, Color b, Color target)
      Converts two colors to integers, performs the bitwise and operation on them, then converts the result to a color.
      Parameters:
      a - the left operand
      b - the right operand
      target - the output color
      Returns:
      the result

      target - the output color
      Returns:
      the negation

      public static Color bitRotateLeft​(Color a, int places, Color target)
      Converts a color to an integer, rotates to the left by the number of places, then converts the result to a color. The rotate a whole color channel, use increments of 8 (8, 16, 24).
      Parameters:
      a - the color
      places - the number of places
      target - the output color

    • fromHex

      public static Color fromHex​(java.lang.String c, Color target)
      Attempts to convert a hexadecimal String to a color. Recognized formats include:
      • "abc" - RGB, one digit per channel.
      • "#abc" - hash tag, RGB, one digit per channel.
      • "aabbcc" - RRGGBB, two digits per channel.
      • "#aabbcc" - hash tag, RRGGBB, two digits per channel.
      • "aabbccdd" - AARRGGBB, two digits per channel.
      • "0xaabbccdd" - '0x' prefix, AARRGGBB, two digits per channel.
      The output color will be reset if no suitable format is recognized.
      Parameters:
      c - the input String
      target - the output color
      Returns:
      the color
      See Also:
      Integer.parseInt(String, int), Long.parseLong(String, int), fromHex(int, Color), String.replaceAll(String, String), String.substring(int)

    • fromHex

      public static Color[] fromHex​(java.lang.String[] cs)
      Converts an array of Strings that represent colors in hexadecimal into an array of colors
      Parameters:
      cs - the colors
      Returns:
      the array

    • gammaAdjust

      public static Color gammaAdjust​(Color c, float gamma, float amplitude, float offset, boolean alpha, Color target)
      Raises a color's red, green and blue channels to an exponent. If alpha is true, then the alpha channel is included. Does not clamp the results; a color channel may exceed the range [0.0, 1.0].
      Parameters:
      c - the color
      gamma - the gamma
      amplitude - the amplitude
      offset - the offset
      alpha - adjust the alpha
      target - the output color
      Returns:
      the result

    • labaToLcha

      public static Vec4 labaToLcha​(float l, float a, float b, float alpha, Vec4 target)
      Converts a color from CIE L*a*b* to CIE LCh. The output is organized as z: L or lightness, y: C or chroma, x: h or hue, w: alpha. The returned hue is in the range [0.0, 1.0] .
      Parameters:
      l - the lightness
      a - the green to red range
      b - the blue to yellow range
      alpha - the alpha channel
      target - the output vector
      Returns:
      the lch vector

    • labaToLcha

      public static Vec4 labaToLcha​(Vec4 source, Vec4 target)
      Converts a color from CIE L*a*b* to CIE LCh. The source should be organized as z: L or lightness, x: a or green-red, y: b or blue-yellow, w: alpha. The returned hue is in the range [0.0, 1.0] .
      Parameters:
      source - the lab vector
      target - the output vector
      Returns:
      the lch color

    • labaToXyza

    • toGplString

      public static java.lang.String toGplString​(Color[] arr, java.lang.String name)
      Returns a String representing the color array in the GIMP palette file format. The number of columns defaults to the square root of the array's length; for example, 16 colors would have 4 columns.
      Parameters:
      arr - the array
      name - the palette name
      Returns:
      the string
      See Also:
      Utils.ceil(float), Utils.sqrt(float)

    • toGplString

      public static java.lang.String toGplString​(Color[] arr, java.lang.String name, int cols)
      Returns a String representing the color array in the GIMP palette file format. The number of columns is for displaying the palette.
      Parameters:
      arr - the array
      name - the palette name
      cols - the display columns
      Returns:
      the string
      See Also:
      Utils.ceil(float), Utils.sqrt(float)

    • toGplString

      public static java.lang.String toGplString​(Color[] arr, java.lang.String name, int cols, boolean useIdx)
      Returns a String representing the color array in the GIMP palette file format. The number of columns is for displaying the palette. A flag indicates whether or not to append the color's index as the final column of each row. Indices begin at 1, not 0.
      Parameters:
      arr - the array
      name - the palette name
      cols - the display columns
      useIdx - append the index
      Returns:
      the string
      See Also:
      toHexWeb(Color)

    • toHexInt

      public static int toHexInt​(Color c)
      Converts a color to an integer where hexadecimal represents the ARGB color channels: 0xAARRGGB .
      Parameters:
      c - the input color
      Returns:
      the color in hexadecimal

    • toHexLong

      c - the input color
      Returns:
      the color in hexadecimal
      See Also:
      toHexInt(Color)

      public static java.lang.String toHexString​(Color c)

      Parameters:
      c - the color
      Returns:
      the string

    • toHexString

      public static java.lang.StringBuilder toHexString​(java.lang.StringBuilder sb, byte a, byte r, byte g, byte b)
      Returns a representation of the color as a hexadecimal code, preceded by a '0x', in the format AARRGGBB. Appends to an existing StringBuilder.
      Parameters:
      sb - the string builder
      a - the alpha byte
      r - the red byte
      g - the green byte
      b - the blue byte
      Returns:
      the string builder
      See Also:
      toHexString(StringBuilder, byte)

    • toHexWeb

      public static java.lang.String toHexWeb​(Color c)
      Creates a web-friendly representation of the color as a hexadecimal code, preceded by a hash tag, '#', with no alpha.
      Parameters:
      c - the color
      Returns:
      the string
      See Also:
      toHexWeb(StringBuilder, Color)

    • toHexWeb

      public static java.lang.String toHexWeb​(int c)
      Returns a web-friendly representation of the color as a hexadecimal code, preceded by a hash tag, '#', with no alpha. Assumes the number will be formatted as 0xAARRGGBB , where alpha is the first channel, followed by red, green and blue.
      Parameters:
      c - the color
      Returns:
      the string
      See Also:
      toHexWeb(StringBuilder, int)

    • toHexWeb

      public static java.lang.StringBuilder toHexWeb​(java.lang.StringBuilder sb, byte r, byte g, byte b)

      g - the green byte
      b - the blue byte

      sb - the string builder
      c - color
      Returns:
      the string builder
      See Also:
      Utils.clamp01(float), toHexWeb(StringBuilder, byte, byte, byte)

    • toHexWeb

      public static java.lang.StringBuilder toHexWeb​(java.lang.StringBuilder sb, int c)
      Creates a web-friendly representation of the color as a hexadecimal code, preceded by a hash tag, '#', with no alpha. Appends to an existing StringBuilder.

      Assumes the number will be formatted as 0xAARRGGBB , where alpha is the first channel, followed by red, green and blue.
      Parameters:
      sb - the string builder
      c - the color
      Returns:
      the string builder
      See Also:
      toHexWeb(StringBuilder, byte, byte, byte)

    • unpremul

      public static Color unpremul​(Color c, Color target)
      Divides the red, green and blue color channels of a color by the alpha channel; reverses premul(Color, Color).
      Parameters:
      c - the input color
      target - the output color
      Returns:
      the multiplied color

      Returns:
      white

    • xyzaToLaba

      public static Vec4 xyzaToLaba​(float x, float y, float z, float a, Vec4 target)
      Converts a color from CIE XYZ to CIE L*a*b*. Assumes D65 illuminant, CIE 1931 2 degrees referents.

      The target is packaged as z: L or lightness, x: a or green-red, y: b or blue-yellow, w: alpha.
      Parameters:
      x - the x coordinate
      y - the y coordinate
      z - the z coordinate
      a - the alpha component
      target - the output vector
      Returns:
      the Lab color
      See Also:
      Math.pow(double, double)

    • xyzaToLaba

      public static Vec4 xyzaToLaba​(Vec4 source, Vec4 target)
      Converts a color from CIE XYZ to CIE L*a*b*.
      Parameters:
      source - the XYZ vector
      target - the output vector
      Returns:
      the Lab color
      See Also:
      xyzaToLaba(float, float, float, float, Vec4)

    • xyzaTolRgba

      public static Color xyzaTolRgba​(float x, float y, float z, float a, Color target)
      Converts a color from CIE XYZ to lRGB. Expects input values to be in the range [0.0, 1.0]. References Pharr, Jakob, and Humphreys' Physically Based Rendering, section 5.2.2, page 327.
      Parameters:
      x - the x coordinate
      y - the y coordinate
      z - the z coordinate
      a - the alpha component
      target - the output color
      Returns:
      the color
      See Also:
      lRgbaToXyza(float, float, float, float, Vec4)

    • xyzaTolRgba

      public static Color xyzaTolRgba​(Vec4 source, Color target)
      Converts a color from CIE XYZ to lRGB.
      Parameters:
      source - the XYZ vector
      target - the output color
      Returns:
      the color
      See Also:
      xyzaTolRgba(float, float, float, float, Color)
